NASB RADIO NETWORK
119 Gregory Hall
Urbans, Illinois
To: All Network Active Affiliates
All other NASB Active Radio Members
All NASB Associate Members
All Sustaining (Commercial) Members
From: Robert Underwood
Date: January 10, 1963
Res Series on "Great Decisions* 1963w
In a memo dated December 28, 1962, we attempted to discover how many of the
network active affiliates would be Interested In contributing funds for the
production of a series of eight (8) half-hour programs based on the Foreign
Policy Association's "Great Decisions" discussion project. The mso. stated
that such a series would be much like that we had last year, with outstanding
world figures speaking on the subjects involved, and if interest was sufficient
we would proceed with production.
We feel that interest has been such that a series will be produced; this will
be 63 Extra I - Great Decisions, 1963 (eight halfÂ«hour programs). The series
will be produced in Washington, D. C. by John F. Lewis, and the first program
will be ready for broadcast use the week beginning February 3. The programs
will not be tied to specific dates and will hold up as public service broadcasts
for several months.
The initial distribution schedule for the programs is as follows:
1. (Issue #6, Release Date: Feb. 3) The Common Market
2. (Issue #7, Release Date: Feb. 10) Red China and the U.S.S.R.
3. (Issue #8, Release Date: Fob. 17) Algeria
4. (Issue #9, Release Date: Bah.24} Spain
5. (Issue #10, Release Date: March 3) India
6. (Issue #11, Release Date: March 10) Laos and Vietnam
7. (Issue #12, Release Date: March 17) The Alliance for Progress
8. (Issue #13, Release Date: March 24) Problems & Prospects for Peace
The series will be available to Active Affiliates at the times given above;
the series will also be available to all others at the times given above
provided that the coverage area of each station involved does not overlap the
coverage area of an Active Affiliate broadcasting the series.
